title: FORMATION TESTER COMPRISING REACTIVE FILTER MATERIAL
abstract: The embodiments herein relate to formation testers having reactive filter materials for detecting analytes in subterranean formation operations. The formation include a body having an outlet, a probe extendable from the body and having a sealing pad and a probe snorkel tube, a flow line within the body, wherein the flow line has an entry end connectable to the probe snorkel tube and an exit end connectable to the outlet in the body, a sample chamber fluidically connectable to the flow line downstream of the entry end of the flow line, and a reactive filter material in the flow line downstream of the sample chamber. The reactive filter material sorbs an analyte in a wellbore fluid.

motivations: There is a need for improved formation testers that can effectively detect analytes in subterranean formation operations.
objectives: Develop a formation tester that incorporates reactive filter materials for detecting analytes in wellbore fluids.
methods: Design a formation tester with a reactive filter material in the flow line downstream of the sample chamber.
Utilize the reactive filter material to sorb analytes in wellbore fluids.
results: Enhance the detection of analytes in subterranean formation operations using reactive filter materials.
llama_json.research_subject: Development of formation testers with reactive filter materials for analyte detection

motivations: There is a need for improved formation testers that can effectively detect analytes in subterranean formation operations.
objectives: Develop a formation tester with a reactive filter material that can absorb analytes in wellbore fluid.
methods: Design a formation tester with a body, an extendable probe, a flow line, a sample chamber, and a reactive filter material.
Place the reactive filter material in the flow line downstream of the sample chamber to sorb analytes in the wellbore fluid.
results: Enable more effective detection of analytes in subterranean formation operations.
openai_json.research_subject: Formation tester with reactive filter material for detecting analytes in subterranean operations

motivations: Current formation testing methods lack efficient capabilities for detecting and analyzing specific analytes in wellbore fluids during subterranean operations.
There is a need for improved formation testing equipment that can selectively capture and identify chemical compounds in downhole environments.
objectives: Develop a formation tester that incorporates reactive filter materials capable of detecting and sorbing specific analytes from wellbore fluids.
Enable real-time or near-real-time chemical analysis of formation fluids during drilling or testing operations.
methods: Integration of reactive filter materials within the flow line of formation testing equipment to selectively sorb target analytes.
Design of a formation tester system with a probe, flow line, sample chamber, and strategically positioned reactive filter material downstream of the sample chamber.
results: Enhanced capability to detect and capture specific chemical analytes present in wellbore fluids during formation testing.
Improved accuracy and efficiency in characterizing subterranean formation fluid composition.
anthropic_json.research_subject: Formation testing equipment with reactive filter materials for analyte detection in wellbore fluids
